creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: calm water, reeds LRC; building and a pavilion on the shore at center in middle ground; buildings reflecting in water; trees growing up a small hill in background
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和拾二年作　石神井 {jizuri, Shōwa jūninen saku, Shakujii} | bottom, printed: Shakujii | in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida

title: Shakujii
